page.title: 11A DAY IN MY LIFE
page.content: I am a seven year old boy and I live at Bittescombe Manor near the village of Upton on the Brendon Hills. My father has a 300 acre farm on which he keeps 300 breeding ewes. My mother, my two brothers and my sister all help at lambing time. In the term time I get up at seven o'clock and get dressed in my school uniform. We have breakfast, sometimes toast, sometimes fried eggs, bacon or sausages. We drink milk, or orange juice from a carton. I then put on my blazer and we drive seveteen miles to school in Taunton. This takes about thirty five minutes and school starts at 9.00 o'clock. School ends at 4.00 and I am given some homework to do. I do this when I get home and so I have some time left to play.
